p: Following the extreme marine heat wave event at Ningaloo Reef in 2011, bleaching was indiscriminate when it came to reserves [ 36, 52], and it will take many years to determine if the areas within the reserves display enhanced recovery. Furthermore, the presence or absence of marine reserves was found to have no bearing on the resistance or recovery of coral reefs in the Seychelles following an extreme bleaching event in 1998 [ 19]. However, poaching and illegal fishing in these reserves is common, in which case, the benefits from reserve protection would not be apparent [ 100, 101].
